page.title: 11GOODWOOD AIRFIELD & SHOPWYKE
page.content: Westerton Farm with a large Farmhouse and Barns is largely an arable farm although sheep are kept. {GOODWOOD AIRFIELD AND M0TOR CIRCUIT} was formerly RAF Westhampnett a World War 2 airfield. It is now used by light aircraft and helicopters. These are flown by business men and women for trips to the continent and other parts of the British Isles. The Motor Circuit is still used for company and individual car testing. There is a pits area,restaurant, car parking and large hangers for the aircraft. (by C. Moller) {SHOPWYKE}is a small cluster of houses standing at an offset crossroads. There is a private boarding school, Westbourne House, set in large gardens on the Coach Road to Westhampnett. There is a garden Centre selling shrubs and garden plants on the Oving
